text: @cyclingreporter Alex Howes, Ben King (as I assume you are referring to Ted King in original tweet), maybe Farrar?
Thank you @BrianCooksonUCI for commitment to constant improvement. Will review include medical info privacy/confidentiality protections?
@Ben_M_Berry I wish ppl well on journey to change rules. I only insist the rules-in-force be observed along the way. In CF case they werent
@Ben_M_Berry @michellecound Please, no more mentions. You've heard the issue and still endorse "vigilante justice". Good day, sir
@Danjordanbrown @michellecound that's an individual decision. But someone in UCI can't leak it for them w/o athlete consent. Huge violation.
@michellecound @Ben_M_Berry @Jenlovescycling exactly. Feel free to change rules. But FOLLOW whatever rules are stated. That's the crux
@Ben_M_Berry @Jenlovescycling @michellecound F me! Are you saying fans/athletes should ALLOW the UCI to ignore rules when it suits them/us?
@JonasHallen @michellecound fly above this particular case and details. Think of precedent it sets if ppl can leak private medical info
@Danjordanbrown @michellecound cyclist or otherwise, shouldnt have to expect that the governing bodies will ignore their own privacy rules
@Ben_M_Berry @Jenlovescycling if you want to discuss newer, more stringent rules, kudos. Different  topic tho. Plz remove me from thread.
@Ben_M_Berry @Jenlovescycling @michellecound you are talking abt rules/regs that don't exist. I am demanding UCI follow the rules in place
@JonasHallen  @michellecound Athlete disclosed inhaler to public by his choice. Doesn't mean UCI can then ignore duty of confidentiality
@Danjordanbrown @michellecound Then lobby WADA & scientists who decide what substances are allowable. Plz follow privacy rules along the way

@Danjordanbrown @michellecound
...maybe UCI needs to review their processes, but you can't disparage a rule-abiding athlete to get there
@Danjordanbrown @michellecound your reply supports my point. Everyone is ignoring the duty of confidentiality owed to the athlete!...
@Ben_M_Berry @michellecound You can disagree w/ the level of permissiveness of existing rules while also supporting athlete privacy
- @Ben_M_Berry @michellecound Then you can lobby to change the rules. Don't out rule-abiding athletes contrary to the stated regulations.
